- CALL 911. Then call emergency response: - CALL 911. Then call emergency response telephone number on shipping paper. If shipping paper not available or no answer, refer to appropriate telephone number listed on the inside back cover. (撥打 119。然後撥打運輸單據上的緊急應變電話。若運輸單據無法取得或無人接聽，請參閱封底內頁列出的適當電話號碼。)
Immediate precautionary measure: Immediate precautionary measure (立即預防措施)
- Keep unauthorized personnel away. (嚴禁非授權人員進入。)
- Stay upwind, uphill and/or upstream. (保持在處於上風、高處及/或河流上游。)
- Wear positive pressure self-contained: - Wear positive pressure self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA). (佩戴正壓式自攜式呼吸防護具 (SCBA)。)
- Structural firefighters' protective cl: - Structural firefighters' protective clothing provides thermal protection but only limited chemical protection. (消防人員裝備僅提供熱防護，對化學防護能力有限。)
- ALWAYS stay away from tanks in direct: - ALWAYS stay away from tanks in direct contact with flames. (始終遠離直接接觸火焰的槽體。)
Refer to the “General First Aid” section: Refer to the “General First Aid” section. Specific First Aid: (請參閱「一般急救」章節。特定急救措施：)
- Cool containers with flooding quantiti: - Cool containers with flooding quantities of water until well after fire is out. (使用大量噴霧水冷卻容器，直至火熄滅後一段時間。)
- Stop leak if you can do it without ris: - Stop leak if you can do it without risk. (在無風險的情況下設法止漏。)
- Fight fire from maximum distance or us: - Fight fire from maximum distance or use unmanned master stream devices or monitor nozzles. (從最遠距離滅火，或使用無人操作的自動射水裝置或固定式水砲。)
- Withdraw immediately in case of rising: - Withdraw immediately in case of rising sound from venting safety devices or discoloration of tank. (若安全洩壓裝置發出的聲音增大或槽體變色，請立即撤離。)
- Prevent entry into waterways, sewers,: - Prevent entry into waterways, sewers, basements or confined areas. (防止洩漏物進入水道、下水道、地下室或受限空間。)
- Ventilate closed spaces before enterin: - Ventilate closed spaces before entering, but only if properly trained and equipped. (進入密閉空間前先進行通風，但僅限受過訓練且裝備齊全的人員執行。)
- Containers may explode when heated. (容器受熱時可能爆炸。)
- Wear chemical protective clothing that: - Wear chemical protective clothing that is specifically recommended by the manufacturer when there is NO RISK OF FIRE. (在無火災風險時，穿戴製造商特別推薦的化學防護衣。)
- Do not touch or walk through spilled m: - Do not touch or walk through spilled material. (不可接觸或走過洩漏物質。)
- ELIMINATE all ignition sources (no smo: - ELIMINATE all ignition sources (no smoking, flares, sparks or flames) from immediate area. (消除區域內所有引火源 (禁止吸菸、火光、火星或火焰)。)
- Runoff from fire control or dilution w: - Runoff from fire control or dilution water may cause environmental contamination. (滅火或稀釋後的殘餘廢水可能造成環境污染。)
- If it can be done safely, move undamag: - If it can be done safely, move undamaged containers away from the area around the fire. (在安全的情況下，將未受損的容器移離火場。)
- If tank, rail tank car or highway tank: - If tank, rail tank car or highway tank is involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions. (若槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車捲入火災，請對四周隔離 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)。)
- Fire will produce irritating, corrosiv: - Fire will produce irritating, corrosive and/or toxic gases. (火災會產生刺激性、腐蝕性及/或有毒氣體。)
- All equipment used when handling the p: - All equipment used when handling the product must be grounded. (處理此產品時使用的所有設備必須接地。)
- For highlighted materials: see Table 1: - For highlighted materials: see Table 1 - Initial Isolation and Protective Action Distances. (對於有標記的物質：請參閱表 1 - 初始隔離與防護行動距離。)
- For non-highlighted materials: increas: - For non-highlighted materials: increase the immediate precautionary measure distance, in the downwind direction, as necessary. Fire (對於未標記的物質：視需要增加下風處的立即預防措施距離。火災)
- Use water spray to reduce vapors or di: - Use water spray to reduce vapors or divert vapor cloud drift. Avoid allowing water runoff to contact spilled material. (使用霧狀水減少蒸氣或引導蒸氣雲飄移。避免讓廢水接觸洩漏物質。)
- Do not touch damaged containers or spi: - Do not touch damaged containers or spilled material unless wearing appropriate protective clothing. (除非穿戴適當的防護衣物，否則不可接觸受損容器或洩漏物質。)
- Vapors may travel to source of ignitio: - Vapors may travel to source of ignition and flash back. (蒸氣可能傳播到引火源並引發回火。)
- Do not get water inside containers. (不可讓水進入容器內。)
- If it can be done safely, move undamag: - If it can be done safely, move undamaged containers away from the area around the fire. Fire Involving Tanks, Rail Tank Cars or Highway Tanks (在安全的情況下，將未受損的容器移離火場。涉及槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車的火災)
- Runoff may create fire or explosion ha: - Runoff may create fire or explosion hazard. (殘餘廢水可能產生火災或爆炸危險。)
- Many gases are heavier than air and wi: - Many gases are heavier than air and will spread along the ground and collect in low or confined areas (sewers, basements, tanks, etc.). (許多氣體比空氣重，會沿地面擴散並積聚在低窪或受限空間 (下水道、地下室、槽體等) 中。)
- May be ignited by heat, sparks or flam: - May be ignited by heat, sparks or flames. (受熱、火星或火焰可能引燃。)
- Those substances designated with a (P): - Those substances designated with a (P) may polymerize explosively when heated or involved in a fire. (標示有 (P) 的物質，在受熱或捲入火災時可能發生爆炸性聚合反應。)
- For massive fire, use unmanned master: - For massive fire, use unmanned master stream devices or monitor nozzles; if this is impossible, withdraw from area and let fire burn. (若是大火，使用無人操作的自動射水裝置或固定式水砲；若無法執行，撤離該區域並讓其燒完。)
- Water spray, fog or regular foam. (使用霧狀水、水霧或普通泡沫。)
- Do not direct water at spill or source: - Do not direct water at spill or source of leak. (噴水時不要對準洩漏處或洩漏源。)
- Isolate spill or leak area in all dire: - Isolate spill or leak area in all directions for at least 50 meters (150 feet) for liquids and at least 25 meters (75 feet) for solids. (液體至少隔離 50 公尺 (150 英呎)，固體至少隔離 25 公尺 (75 英呎)。)
- Do not direct water at source of leak: - Do not direct water at source of leak or safety devices; icing may occur. (噴水時不要對準洩漏源或安全裝置；否則可能會結冰。)
- If possible, turn leaking containers s: - If possible, turn leaking containers so that gas escapes rather than liquid. (如果可能，轉動洩漏容器，使其排出氣體而非液體。)
- Dike far ahead of liquid spill for lat: - Dike far ahead of liquid spill for later disposal. (在液體洩漏的前方遠處築堤，以便後續處理。)
- Consider initial downwind evacuation f: - Consider initial downwind evacuation for at least 100 meters (330 feet). Fire (考慮對下風處進行初始疏散至少 100 公尺 (330 英呎)。火災)
- Vapors from liquefied gas are initiall: - Vapors from liquefied gas are initially heavier than air and spread along ground. (液化氣體的蒸氣最初比空氣重，會沿地面擴散。)
- Dry chemical, CO2, water spray or regu: - Dry chemical, CO2, water spray or regular foam. (使用乾粉、二氧化碳、霧狀水或普通泡沫。)
- Keep combustibles (wood, paper, oil, e: - Keep combustibles (wood, paper, oil, etc.) away from spilled material. (將易燃物 (木材、紙張、油等) 遠離洩漏物質。)
- Ruptured cylinders may rocket. (破裂的鋼瓶可能會像火箭般噴射。)
- Isolate area until gas has dispersed. (隔離區域直到氣體擴散為止。)
- In case of contact with liquefied gas,: - In case of contact with liquefied gas, only medical personnel should attempt thawing frosted parts. (若接觸到液化氣體，僅能由醫療人員嘗試解凍凍傷部位。)
- In case of burns, immediately cool aff: - In case of burns, immediately cool affected skin for as long as possible with cold water. Do not remove clothing if adhering to skin. (若發生灼傷，請立即用冷水冷卻受影響的皮膚。若衣服黏貼在皮膚上，請勿強行脫去。)
- Do not move cargo or vehicle if cargo: - Do not move cargo or vehicle if cargo has been exposed to heat. (若貨物已暴露於熱源中，請勿移動貨物或車輛。)
- DO NOT CLEAN-UP OR DISPOSE OF, EXCEPT: - DO NOT CLEAN-UP OR DISPOSE OF, EXCEPT UNDER SUPERVISION OF A SPECIALIST. (除非在專家的監督下，否則不可清理或處置。)
- May ignite combustibles (wood, paper,: - May ignite combustibles (wood, paper, oil, clothing, etc.). (可能引燃易燃物 (木材、紙張、油、衣物等)。)
- Damaged cylinders should be handled on: - Damaged cylinders should be handled only by specialists. Fire Involving Tanks (損壞的鋼瓶應僅由專家處理。涉及槽體的火災)
- Dry chemical or CO2. (使用乾粉或二氧化碳。)
- Water spray, fog or alcohol-resistant: - Water spray, fog or alcohol-resistant foam. (使用霧狀水、水霧或抗酒精泡沫。)
- Contact with gas or liquefied gas may: - Contact with gas or liquefied gas may cause burns, severe injury and/or frostbite. (接觸氣體或液化氣體可能造成灼傷、重傷及/或凍傷。)
- Isolate spill or leak area for at leas: - Isolate spill or leak area for at least 100 meters (330 feet) in all directions. (對四周至少 100 公尺 (330 英呎) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。)
Refer to the “General First Aid” section: Refer to the “General First Aid” section. (請參閱「一般急救」章節。)
- A vapor-suppressing foam may be used t: - A vapor-suppressing foam may be used to reduce vapors. (可使用抑制蒸氣的泡沫來減少蒸氣量。)
- Runoff from fire control or dilution w: - Runoff from fire control or dilution water may be corrosive and/or toxic and cause environmental contamination. (滅火或稀釋後的殘餘廢水可能具腐蝕性及/或毒性，並造成環境污染。)
- Flood fire area with water from a dist: - Flood fire area with water from a distance. (從遠距離向火場噴灑大量水。)
- DO NOT EXTINGUISH A LEAKING GAS FIRE U: - DO NOT EXTINGUISH A LEAKING GAS FIRE UNLESS LEAK CAN BE STOPPED. (除非能止漏，否則不可撲滅正在洩漏的瓦斯火災。)
- Fire may produce irritating and/or tox: - Fire may produce irritating and/or toxic gases. (火災可能產生刺激性及/或有毒氣體。)
- Most vapors are heavier than air. They: - Most vapors are heavier than air. They will spread along the ground and collect in low or confined areas (sewers, basements, tanks, etc.). (多數蒸氣比空氣重。會沿地面擴散並積聚在低窪或受限空間 (下水道、地下室、槽體等) 中。)
- Absorb or cover with dry earth, sand o: - Absorb or cover with dry earth, sand or other non-combustible material and transfer to containers. (使用乾土、沙或其他非易燃材料吸收或覆蓋，並移至容器內。)
- Isolate spill or leak area for at leas: - Isolate spill or leak area for at least 25 meters (75 feet) in all directions. (對四周至少 25 公尺 (75 英呎) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。)
- Cover with DRY earth, DRY sand or othe: - Cover with DRY earth, DRY sand or other non-combustible material followed with plastic sheet to minimize spreading or contact with rain. (使用乾土、乾沙或其他非易燃材料覆蓋，並加上塑膠布遮蓋以減少擴散或與雨水接觸。)
- If tank, rail tank car or highway tank: - If tank, rail tank car or highway tank is involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 1600 meters (1 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 1600 meters (1 mile) in all directions. (若槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車捲入火災，請對四周隔離 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)。)
- Runoff to sewer may create fire or exp: - Runoff to sewer may create fire or explosion hazard. (流入下水道的廢水可能產生火災或爆炸危險。)
- Dry chemical, CO2, water spray or alco: - Dry chemical, CO2, water spray or alcohol-resistant foam. (使用乾粉、二氧化碳、霧狀水或抗酒精泡沫。)
- For massive fire, use unmanned master: - For massive fire, use unmanned master stream devices or monitor nozzles; if this is impossible, withdraw from area and let fire burn. (若是大火，使用無人操作的自動射水裝置或固定式水砲；若無法執行，撤離該區域並讓其燒完。)
- Vapors may cause dizziness or asphyxia: - Vapors may cause dizziness or asphyxiation, especially when in closed or confined areas. (蒸氣可能導致暈眩或窒息，特別是在密閉或受限空間中。)
- Dike runoff from fire control for late: - Dike runoff from fire control for later disposal. (築堤攔截滅火廢水，以便後續處理。)
- For corrosives, in case of contact, im: - For corrosives, in case of contact, immediately flush skin or eyes with running water for at least 30 minutes. Additional flushing may be required. (若接觸腐蝕性物質，請立即用大量清水沖洗皮膚或眼睛至少 30 分鐘。可能需要更長時間的沖洗。)
- Corrosives in contact with metals may: - Corrosives in contact with metals may evolve flammable hydrogen gas. (腐蝕性物質與金屬接觸可能產生易燃的氫氣。)
- DO NOT GET WATER on spilled substance: - DO NOT GET WATER on spilled substance or inside containers. (不可讓水接觸洩漏物質或進入容器內部。)
- Vapors may cause dizziness or asphyxia: - Vapors may cause dizziness or asphyxiation without warning, especially when in closed or confined areas. (蒸氣可能在無預警的情況下導致暈眩或窒息，特別是在密閉或受限空間中。)
- Use extinguishing agent suitable for t: - Use extinguishing agent suitable for type of surrounding fire. (使用適合周圍火災類型的滅火劑。)
- Vapors may form explosive mixtures wit: - Vapors may form explosive mixtures with air. (蒸氣與空氣可能形成爆炸性混合物。)
- Many liquids will float on water. (許多液體會浮於水面上。)
- Isolate spill or leak area for at leas: - Isolate spill or leak area for at least 50 meters (150 feet) in all directions. (對四周至少 50 公尺 (150 英呎) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。)
- Avoid aiming straight or solid streams: - Avoid aiming straight or solid streams directly onto the product. (噴水時應避免直接將強力水柱對準產品。)
- Use clean, non-sparking tools to colle: - Use clean, non-sparking tools to collect absorbed material. (使用乾淨、不產生火花的工具收集已吸收的物質。)
- Water spray may reduce vapor, but may: - Water spray may reduce vapor, but may not prevent ignition in closed spaces. (霧狀水可能減少蒸氣，但在密閉空間內可能無法防止引燃。)
- May re-ignite after fire is extinguish: - May re-ignite after fire is extinguished. (火撲滅後可能復燃。)
- Contact with molten substance may caus: - Contact with molten substance may cause severe burns to skin and eyes. (接觸熔融物質可能造成皮膚及眼睛嚴重灼傷。)
- Dike runoff from fire control for late: - Dike runoff from fire control for later disposal. Fire Involving Tanks, Rail Tank Cars or Highway Tanks (築堤攔截滅火廢水，以便後續處理。涉及槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車的火災)
- Use clean, non-sparking tools to colle: - Use clean, non-sparking tools to collect material and place it into loosely covered plastic containers for later disposal. (使用乾淨、不產生火花的工具收集物質，並放入鬆蓋的塑膠容器中，以便後續處理。)
- Dry chemical, CO2 or water spray. (使用乾粉、二氧化碳或霧狀水。)
- Radiation presents minimal risk to tra: - Radiation presents minimal risk to transport workers, emergency response personnel and the public during transportation accidents. Packaging durability increases as potential hazard of radioactive content increases. (在運輸事故中，輻射對運輸工人、緊急應變人員及公眾的風險極低。隨著放射性內容物潛在危害的增加，包裝的耐用性也會提高。)
- Priorities for rescue, life-saving, fi: - Priorities for rescue, life-saving, first aid, fire control and other hazards are higher than the priority for measuring radiation levels. (救援、生命安全、急救、滅火及其他危害的優先等級高於測量輻射強度的優先等級。)
- Radiation Authority must be notified o: - Radiation Authority must be notified of accident conditions. Radiation Authority is usually responsible for decisions about radiological consequences and closure of emergencies. (必須將事故狀況通知輻射主管機關。主管機關通常負責放射性後果的決策及緊急狀態的解除。)
- Do not touch damaged packages or spill: - Do not touch damaged packages or spilled material. (不可接觸受損包裹或洩漏物質。)
- Medical problems take priority over ra: - Medical problems take priority over radiological concerns. (醫療問題優先於輻射考量。)
- Use first aid treatment according to t: - Use first aid treatment according to the nature of the injury. (根據受傷性質進行急救處理。)
- Some of these materials may react viol: - Some of these materials may react violently with water. (某些物質與水接觸會產生劇烈反應。)
- Vapor explosion hazard indoors, outdoo: - Vapor explosion hazard indoors, outdoors or in sewers. (室內、室外或下水道有蒸氣爆炸危險。)
- Consider initial downwind evacuation f: - Consider initial downwind evacuation for at least 300 meters (1000 feet). Fire (考慮對下風處進行初始疏散至少 300 公尺 (1000 英呎)。火災)
- Wash skin with soap and water. (用肥皂和水清洗皮膚。)
- Avoid aiming straight or solid streams: - Avoid aiming straight or solid streams directly onto the product. Fire Involving Tanks, Rail Tank Cars or Highway Tanks (避免將強力水柱直接對準產品。涉及槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車的火災)
- Removal of solidified molten material: - Removal of solidified molten material from skin requires medical assistance. (從皮膚上移除凝固的熔融物質需要醫療協助。)
- May burn rapidly with flare-burning ef: - May burn rapidly with flare-burning effect. (可能迅速燃燒並產生閃火效應。)
- Consider initial evacuation for at lea: - Consider initial evacuation for at least 250 meters (800 feet) in all directions. Fire (考慮對四周進行初始疏散至少 250 公尺 (800 英呎)。火災)
- Pick up with inert, damp, non-combusti: - Pick up with inert, damp, non-combustible material using clean, non-sparking tools and place into loosely covered plastic containers for later disposal. (使用乾淨、不產生火花的工具以惰性、潮濕、非易燃材料拾起，並放入鬆蓋的塑膠容器中以便後續處理。)
- DO NOT GET WATER INSIDE CONTAINERS. (不可讓水進入容器內。)
- Radioactivity does not change flammabi: - Radioactivity does not change flammability or other properties of materials. (放射性不會改變物質的易燃性或其他性質。)
- Detain or isolate uninjured persons or: - Detain or isolate uninjured persons or equipment suspected to be contaminated; delay decontamination and cleanup until instructions are received from Radiation Authority. (扣留或隔離疑似受污染的未受傷人員或設備；延後除污及清理工作，直到收到輻射主管機關的指示。)
- Presence of radioactive material will: - Presence of radioactive material will not influence the fire control processes and should not influence selection of techniques. (放射性物質的存在不會影響滅火過程，也不應影響技術的選擇。)
- Do not move damaged packages; move und: - Do not move damaged packages; move undamaged packages out of fire zone. (不要移動受損的包裹；將未受損的包裹移出火場。)
- Water spray, fog (flooding amounts). (使用大量霧狀水、水霧。)
- Do not delay care and transport of a s: - Do not delay care and transport of a seriously injured person. (不可延誤傷勢嚴重者的護理及轉送。)
- May form explosive mixtures with air. (與空氣可能形成爆炸性混合物。)
- Cylinders exposed to fire may vent and: - Cylinders exposed to fire may vent and release toxic and flammable gas through pressure relief devices. (暴露於火場中的鋼瓶可能透過壓力洩放裝置排出並釋放有毒且易燃的氣體。)
- Contact may cause burns to skin and ey: - Contact may cause burns to skin and eyes. (接觸可能造成皮膚及眼睛灼傷。)
- Wet down with water and dike for later: - Wet down with water and dike for later disposal. (用水淋濕並築堤攔截以便後續處理。)
- Cylinders exposed to fire may vent and: - Cylinders exposed to fire may vent and release flammable gas through pressure relief devices. (暴露於火場中的鋼瓶可能透過壓力洩放裝置排出並釋放易燃氣體。)
- Contact with gas, liquefied gas or cry: - Contact with gas, liquefied gas or cryogenic liquids may cause burns, severe injury and/or frostbite. (接觸氣體、液化氣體或極低溫液體可能造成灼傷、重傷及/或凍傷。)
- Water spray or fog. (霧狀水或水霧。)
- See Table 1 - Initial Isolation and Pr: - See Table 1 - Initial Isolation and Protective Action Distances. Fire (請參閱表 1 - 初始隔離與防護行動距離。火災)
- FOR CHLOROSILANES, use alcohol-resista: - FOR CHLOROSILANES, use alcohol-resistant foam to reduce vapors. (對於氯矽烷類，請使用抗酒精泡沫來減少蒸氣量。)
- Some may burn but none ignite readily. (某些可能燃燒，但不會輕易引燃。)

- HIGHLY FLAMMABLE: Will be easily ignit: - HIGHLY FLAMMABLE: Will be easily ignited by heat, sparks or flames. (極易燃：受熱、火星或火焰極易引燃。)

- Some may decompose explosively when he: - Some may decompose explosively when heated or involved in a fire. (某些在受熱或捲入火災時可能發生爆炸性分解。)
- Substance may be transported in a molt: - Substance may be transported in a molten form. (該物質可能以熔融形式運輸。)
- Reaction with water may generate much: - Reaction with water may generate much heat that will increase the concentration of fumes in the air. (與水反應可能產生大量熱能，進而增加空氣中煙霧的濃度。)
- Containers may explode when heated or: - Containers may explode when heated or if contaminated with water. (容器在受熱或被水污染時可能爆炸。)
- Inhalation or contact with vapors, sub: - Inhalation or contact with vapors, substance or decomposition products may cause severe injury or death. (吸入或接觸蒸氣、物質或分解產物可能造成嚴重傷害或死亡。)
- These substances will accelerate burni: - These substances will accelerate burning when involved in a fire. (這些物質捲入火災時會加速燃燒。)
- May explode from heat or contamination: - May explode from heat or contamination. (受熱或受污染可能引發爆炸。)
- Some will react explosively with hydro: - Some will react explosively with hydrocarbons (fuels). (某些與烴類 (燃料) 會產生爆炸性反應。)
- Use water. Do not use dry chemicals or: - Use water. Do not use dry chemicals or foams. CO2 or Halon® may provide limited control. (使用噴水。請勿使用乾粉或泡沫。二氧化碳或海龍滅火劑 (Halon®) 僅能提供有限控制。)
- Avoid any skin contact. (避免任何皮膚接觸。)
- Runoff may pollute waterways. (殘餘廢水可能污染水道。)
- Some radioactive materials cannot be d: - Some radioactive materials cannot be detected by commonly available instruments. (某些放射性物質無法由市售通用儀器偵測到。)
- Injured persons contaminated by contac: - Injured persons contaminated by contact with released material are not a serious hazard to health care personnel, equipment or facilities. (因接觸外洩物質而受污染的傷者，對醫護人員、設備或設施不會構成嚴重威脅。)
- TOXIC; Extremely Hazardous. (有毒；極度危險。)
- If it can be done safely, move undamag: - If it can be done safely, move undamaged containers away from the area around the fire. Fire Involving Tanks (在安全的情況下，將未受損的容器移離火場。涉及槽體的火災)
- Pick up with sand or other non-combust: - Pick up with sand or other non-combustible absorbent material and place into containers for later disposal. (使用沙或其他非易燃吸收材料拾起並放入容器內以便後續處理。)
- DO NOT fight fire when fire reaches ca: - DO NOT fight fire when fire reaches cargo! Cargo may EXPLODE! (當火焰觸及貨物時請勿滅火！貨物可能爆炸！)
TIRE or VEHICLE Fire: TIRE or VEHICLE Fire (輪胎或車輛火災)
- Use plenty of water - FLOOD it! If wat: - Use plenty of water - FLOOD it! If water is not available, use CO2, dry chemical or dirt. (使用大量的水 - 淹沒它！若無水可用，請使用二氧化碳、乾粉或土。)
- If possible, and WITHOUT RISK, use unm: - If possible, and WITHOUT RISK, use unmanned master stream devices or monitor nozzles from maximum distance to prevent fire from spreading to cargo area. (如果可能，且在無風險的情況下，從最遠距離使用無人操作的自動射水裝置或固定式水砲以防止火勢蔓延至貨物區。)
- Pay special attention to tire fires as: - Pay special attention to tire fires as re-ignition may occur. Stand by, at a safe distance, with extinguisher ready for possible re-ignition. (特別注意輪胎火災，因為可能復燃。在安全距離處待命，並準備好滅火器以應對可能的復燃。)
- Always wear thermal protective clothin: - Always wear thermal protective clothing when handling refrigerated/cryogenic liquids. (處理冷凍/極低溫液體時務必穿戴熱防護衣。)
- Consider initial downwind evacuation f: - Consider initial downwind evacuation for at least 800 meters (1/2 mile). Fire (考慮對下風處進行初始疏散至少 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)。火災)
- Clothing frozen to the skin should be: - Clothing frozen to the skin should be thawed before being removed. (凍結在皮膚上的衣物應先解凍再移除。)
- FOR CHLOROSILANES, DO NOT USE WATER; u: - FOR CHLOROSILANES, DO NOT USE WATER; use alcohol-resistant foam. (對於氯矽烷類，不可用水；請使用抗酒精泡沫。)
- Use water spray to reduce vapors or di: - Use water spray to reduce vapors or divert vapor cloud drift. Avoid allowing water runoff to contact spilled material. (使用霧狀水減少蒸氣或引導蒸氣雲飄移。避免讓廢水接觸洩漏物質。)
- Allow substance to evaporate. (讓物質蒸發。)
- Substance does not burn but will suppo: - Substance does not burn but will support combustion. (物質本身不燃，但會助燃。)
- Cylinders exposed to fire may vent and: - Cylinders exposed to fire may vent and release toxic and/or corrosive gas through pressure relief devices. (暴露於火場中的鋼瓶可能透過壓力洩放裝置排出並釋放有毒及/或腐蝕性氣體。)
- Ventilate the area. (保持區域通風。)
- Absorb with earth, sand or other non-c: - Absorb with earth, sand or other non-combustible material. (使用土、沙或其他非易燃材料吸收。)
- With clean shovel, place material into: - With clean shovel, place material into clean, dry container and cover loosely; move containers from spill area. (用乾淨的鏟子將物質放入乾淨、乾燥的容器中並鬆蓋；將容器移離洩漏區域。)
- When heated, vapors may form explosive: - When heated, vapors may form explosive mixtures with air: indoors, outdoors and sewers explosion hazards. (受熱時，蒸氣與空氣可能形成爆炸性混合物：造成室內、室外及下水道的爆炸危險。)
- TOXIC and/or CORROSIVE; inhalation, in: - TOXIC and/or CORROSIVE; inhalation, ingestion or skin contact with material may cause severe injury or death. (有毒及/或腐蝕性；吸入、食入或皮膚接觸物質可能造成嚴重傷害或死亡。)
- Some react vigorously or explosively o: - Some react vigorously or explosively on contact with water. (某些接觸水會產生劇烈或爆炸性反應。)
- Do not scatter spilled material with h: - Do not scatter spilled material with high-pressure water streams. (不可使用高壓水柱分散洩漏物質。)
- Dry chemical, soda ash, lime or sand. (使用乾粉、純鹼 (蘇打灰)、石灰或沙。)
- DRY sand, dry chemical, soda ash or li: - DRY sand, dry chemical, soda ash or lime or withdraw from area and let fire burn. (使用乾沙、乾粉、純鹼或石灰，或者撤離該區域並讓其燒完。)
- Ingestion or contact (skin, eyes) with: - Ingestion or contact (skin, eyes) with substance may cause severe injury or burns. (食入或接觸 (皮膚、眼睛) 此物質可能造成重傷或灼傷。)
- Water spray or fog is preferred; if wa: - Water spray or fog is preferred; if water not available use dry chemical, CO2 or regular foam. (霧狀水或水霧為首選；若無水可用請使用乾粉、二氧化碳或普通泡沫。)
- Use water spray or fog; avoid aiming s: - Use water spray or fog; avoid aiming straight or solid streams directly onto the product. (使用霧狀水或水霧；避免將強力水柱直接對準產品。)
- BEWARE OF POSSIBLE CONTAINER EXPLOSION: - BEWARE OF POSSIBLE CONTAINER EXPLOSION. (慎防容器爆炸。)
- Non-combustible, substance itself does: - Non-combustible, substance itself does not burn but may decompose upon heating to produce corrosive and/or toxic fumes. (非易燃，物質本身不燃，但受熱分解可能產生腐蝕性及/或有毒煙霧。)
- Combustible material: may burn but doe: - Combustible material: may burn but does not ignite readily. (可燃物質：可能燃燒但不會輕易引燃。)
- Dry chemical, CO2, alcohol-resistant f: - Dry chemical, CO2, alcohol-resistant foam or water spray. (使用乾粉、二氧化碳、抗酒精泡沫或霧狀水。)
- TOXIC and/or CORROSIVE; inhalation, in: - TOXIC and/or CORROSIVE; inhalation, ingestion or contact (skin, eyes) with vapors, dusts or substance may cause severe injury, burns or death. (有毒及/或腐蝕性；吸入、食入或接觸 (皮膚、眼睛) 蒸氣、粉塵或物質可能造成嚴重傷害、灼傷或死亡。)
- Reaction with water or moist air may r: - Reaction with water or moist air may release toxic, corrosive or flammable gases. (與水或潮濕空氣反應可能釋放出有毒、腐蝕性或易燃氣體。)
- Some of these materials may burn, but: - Some of these materials may burn, but none ignite readily. (某些可能燃燒，但不會輕易引燃。)
- Some of these materials may burn, but most do not ignite readily. (某些可能燃燒，但多數不會輕易引燃。)
- Cover liquid spill with sand, earth or: - Cover liquid spill with sand, earth or other non-combustible absorbent material. (使用沙、土或其他非易燃吸收材料覆蓋液體洩漏。)
- Cover powder spill with plastic sheet: - Cover powder spill with plastic sheet or tarp to minimize spreading. (使用塑膠布或防水布覆蓋粉末洩漏以減少擴散。)
- Undamaged packages are safe. Contents: - Undamaged packages are safe. Contents of damaged packages may cause higher external radiation exposure, or both external and internal radiation exposure if contents are released. (未受損的包裹是安全的。受損包裹的內容物可能導致較高的體外輻射暴露，若內容物外洩，則可能導致體外及體內輻射暴露。)
- Positive pressure self-contained breat: - Positive pressure self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA) and structural firefighters’ protective clothing will provide adequate protection against internal radiation exposure, but not external radiation exposure. (正壓式自攜式呼吸防護具 (SCBA) 及消防人員防護衣可針對體內輻射暴露提供適當防護，但對體外輻射暴露無效。)
- May be fatal if inhaled or absorbed th: - May be fatal if inhaled or absorbed through skin. (吸入或經皮膚吸收可能致命。)
- Initial odor may be irritating or foul: - Initial odor may be irritating or foul and may deaden your sense of smell. (最初的氣味可能具有刺激性或惡臭，並可能使嗅覺遲鈍。)
- These materials are extremely flammabl: - These materials are extremely flammable. (這些物質極度易燃。)
- See Table 1 - Initial Isolation and Pr: - See Table 1 - Initial Isolation and Protective Action Distances. Fire (請參閱表 1 - 初始隔離與防護行動距離。火災)
- Consider igniting spill or leak to eli: - Consider igniting spill or leak to eliminate toxic gas concerns. (考慮引燃洩漏物以消除有毒氣體的顧慮。)
- May explode from heat, shock, friction: - May explode from heat, shock, friction or contamination. (受熱、撞擊、摩擦或受污染可能引發爆炸。)
- Move people out of line of sight of th: - Move people out of line of sight of the scene and away from windows. (將人員移開事故現場視線範圍外，並遠離窗戶。)

- Isolate spill or leak area immediately: - Isolate spill or leak area immediately for at least 100 meters (330 feet) in all directions. (立即對四周至少 100 公尺 (330 英呎) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。)
- Flush area with large amounts of water: - Flush area with large amounts of water. (使用大量清水沖洗該區域。)

- Prevent spreading of vapors through se: - Prevent spreading of vapors through sewers, ventilation systems and confined areas. (防止蒸氣透過下水道、通風系統及受限空間擴散。)
- Isolate area until gas has dispersed. CAUTION: When in contact with refrigerated/cryogenic liquids, many materials become brittle and are likely to break without warning. (隔離區域直到氣體擴散為止。注意：接觸冷凍/極低溫液體時，許多材料會變脆並且可能在無預警的情況下破碎。)

- Consider initial downwind evacuation f: - Consider initial downwind evacuation for at least 500 meters (1/3 mile). Fire (考慮對下風處進行初始疏散至少 500 公尺 (1/3 英哩)。火災)

- Vapor explosion and poison hazard indo: - Vapor explosion and poison hazard indoors, outdoors or in sewers. (室內、室外或下水道有蒸氣爆炸及中毒危險。)
- May be ignited by friction, heat, spar: - May be ignited by friction, heat, sparks or flames. (摩擦、受熱、火星或火焰可能引燃。)
- May ignite on contact with water or mo: - May ignite on contact with water or moist air. (與水或潮濕空氣接觸可能引燃。)
- Some are transported in highly flammab: - Some are transported in highly flammable liquids. (某些是在高度易燃的液體中運輸。)
- May produce corrosive solutions on con: - May produce corrosive solutions on contact with water. (與水接觸可能產生腐蝕性溶液。)
- DO NOT USE WATER OR FOAM. (不可使用水或泡沫。)
- Dike for later disposal; do not apply: - Dike for later disposal; do not apply water unless directed to do so. Powder Spill (築堤攔截以便後續處理；除非收到指示，否則不要噴水。粉末洩漏)
- Cover powder spill with plastic sheet: - Cover powder spill with plastic sheet or tarp to minimize spreading and keep powder dry. (使用塑膠布或防水布覆蓋粉末洩漏以減少擴散並保持粉末乾燥。)
- In case of contact with substance, wip: - In case of contact with substance, wipe from skin immediately; flush skin or eyes with running water for at least 20 minutes. (若接觸此物質，請立即從皮膚擦除；用清水沖洗皮膚或眼睛至少 20 分鐘。)
- Use a non-combustible material like ve: - Use a non-combustible material like vermiculite or sand to soak up the product and place into a container for later disposal. (使用蛭石或沙等非易燃材料吸附產品，並放入容器內以便後續處理。)
- Use water spray to reduce vapors or di: - Use water spray to reduce vapors or divert vapor cloud drift. (使用霧狀水減少蒸氣或引導蒸氣雲飄移。)
- Keep substance wet using water spray. (使用霧狀水保持物質濕潤。)
- Contaminated clothing may be a fire ri: - Contaminated clothing may be a fire risk when dry. (被污染的衣物乾燥後可能會有火災風險。)
- The temperature of the substance must: - The temperature of the substance must be maintained at or below the “Control Temperature” at all times. (物質的溫度必須始終保持在「控制溫度」或以下。)
- DO NOT allow the substance to warm up. Use a coolant agent such as dry ice or ice (wear thermal protective gloves). If this is not possible or none can be obtained, evacuate the area immediately. (不可讓物質升溫。使用乾冰或冰等冷卻劑 (戴熱防護手套)。若無法執行或無法取得冷卻劑，請立即疏散該區域。)
- Self-decomposition, self-polymerizatio: - Self-decomposition, self-polymerization, or self-ignition may be triggered by heat, chemical reaction, friction or impact. (受熱、化學反應、摩擦或撞擊可能引發自發性分解、自發性聚合或自燃。)
- May burn violently. Decomposition or p: - May burn violently. Decomposition or polymerization may be self-accelerating and produce large amounts of gases. (可能劇烈燃燒。分解或聚合反應可能具自加速性並產生大量氣體。)
- Vapors or dust may form explosive mixt: - Vapors or dust may form explosive mixtures with air. (蒸氣或粉塵與空氣可能形成爆炸性混合物。)
- May produce irritating, toxic and/or c: - May produce irritating, toxic and/or corrosive gases. (可能產生刺激性、有毒及/或腐蝕性氣體。)
- Highly toxic, may be fatal if inhaled,: - Highly toxic, may be fatal if inhaled, ingested or absorbed through skin. (高毒性，吸入、食入或經皮膚吸收可能致命。)
- Cover with plastic sheet to prevent sp: - Cover with plastic sheet to prevent spreading. (使用塑膠布覆蓋以防止擴散。)
- Substance will react with water (some: - Substance will react with water (some violently) releasing flammable, toxic or corrosive gases and runoff. (物質與水會產生反應 (某些相當劇烈)，釋放出易燃、有毒或腐蝕性氣體及廢水。)
- CO2, dry chemical, dry sand, alcohol-r: - CO2, dry chemical, dry sand, alcohol-resistant foam. (使用二氧化碳、乾粉、乾沙、抗酒精泡沫。)
- Exposure in an enclosed area may be ve: - Exposure in an enclosed area may be very harmful. (在密閉空間內暴露可能非常有害。)
- Positive pressure self-contained breat: - Positive pressure self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA) and structural firefighters’ protective clothing will provide adequate protection. (正壓式自攜式呼吸防護具 (SCBA) 及消防人員防護衣將提供適當防護。)
- When a large quantity of this material: - When a large quantity of this material is involved in a major fire, consider an initial evacuation distance of 300 meters (1000 feet) in all directions. (當大量此類物質捲入大火時，考慮對四周進行初始疏散距離為 300 公尺 (1000 英呎)。)
- Runoff from control of cargo fire may: - Runoff from control of cargo fire may cause low-level pollution. (控制貨物火災的殘餘廢水可能導致低度污染。)
- Radioactive White-I labels indicate ra: - Radioactive White-I labels indicate radiation levels outside single, isolated, undamaged packages are very low (less than 0.005 mSv/h (0.5 mrem/h)). (放射性白色-I 標籤表示單個隔離、未受損包裹外部的輻射強度極低 (低於 0.005 mSv/h (0.5 mrem/h))。)
- Radioactive Yellow-II and Yellow-III l: - Radioactive Yellow-II and Yellow-III labeled packages have higher radiation levels. The transport index (TI) on the label identifies the maximum radiation level in mrem/h one meter from a single, isolated, undamaged package. (標示為放射性黃色-II 及黃色-III 的包裹輻射強度較高。運輸指數 (TI) 標示了距離單個隔離、未受損包裹一公尺處的最大輻射強度 (mrem/h)。)
- Stay upwind, uphill and/or upstream.        •   Keep unauthorized personnel away. (保持在處於上風、高處及/或河流上游。 • 嚴禁非授權人員進入。)
- When a large quantity of this material: - When a large quantity of this material is involved in a major fire, consider an initial evacuation distance of 300 meters (1000 feet) in all directions. (當大量此類物質捲入大火時，考慮對四周進行初始疏散距離為 300 公尺 (1000 英呎)。)
- Water from cargo fire control is not e: - Water from cargo fire control is not expected to cause pollution. (控制貨物火災產生的廢水預期不會造成污染。)
- Contact with gas may cause burns and i: - Contact with gas may cause burns and injury. (接觸氣體可能造成灼傷及傷害。)
- Damaged cylinders should be handled on: - Damaged cylinders should be handled only by specialists. Fire Involving Several Small Packages (inside a railcar or trailer) (損壞的鋼瓶應僅由專家處理。涉及多個小包裝 (在鐵路貨車或拖車內) 的火災)

ADEQUATELY TRAINED AND EQUIPPED PERSONNE: ADEQUATELY TRAINED AND EQUIPPED PERSONNEL (受過適當訓練且配備齊全的人員執行)
- This section is divided into three sub: - This section is divided into three subsections: ›› General Information: describes initial precautionary measures to be taken by those first on the scene. ›› PROTECTIVE CLOTHING: provides general guidance on personal protective equipment requirements including respiratory protection. The protective clothing information is general and correct selection is situation dependent, after considering the physical and chemical properties of the material, weather conditions, spill versus fire, topography, etc. ›› EVACUATION: suggests protective distances for immediate precautionary measures defined for small and large spills, including suggested guidance for conditions where fire is present or likely (potential fragmentation hazard). −−The term “isolate” indicates a zone of no entry that applies to the public and first responders who are not equipped, trained, and prepared to mitigate the incident. −−The term “evacuate” aims to protect as many people as possible by removing persons from inside a zone safely. If removal is too risky, sheltering-in-place can also be considered in this zone. (此章節分為三個子章節： ›› 一般資訊：描述首批到達現場的人員應採取的初始預防措施。 ›› 防護衣物：提供個人防護裝備要求的通用指引，包括呼吸防護。防護衣物資訊屬通用性質，正確選擇需視情況而定，需考慮物質的理化性質、天氣狀況、洩漏與火災的對比、地形等。 ›› 疏散：針對小規模和大規模洩漏定義的立即預防措施建議防護距離，包括火災存在或可能發生時的建議指引 (潛在碎片拋射危險)。 －－「隔離」一詞表示禁止進入區，適用於公眾及未配備裝備、未受訓且未準備好處置事故的首批應變人員。 －－「疏散」一詞旨在透過安全地將人員從區域內移走來保護盡可能多的人。若移走風險太大，該區域也可考慮就地避難。)
- Materials highlighted in green in the: - Materials highlighted in green in the yellow and blue sections direct the reader to consult Table 1, detailing specific response distances for toxic inhalation hazard materials and water-reactive materials (green section). (黃色和藍色章節中以綠色標記的物質指示讀者查閱表 1，詳細說明吸入毒性危害物質及禁水反應物質的特定應變距離 (綠色章節)。)
- This section is divided into three sub: - This section is divided into three subsections: ›› FIRE: provides extinguishing procedures for Small Fire, Large Fire, and/ or Fire Involving Tanks or Car/Trailer Loads ›› SPILL OR LEAK: includes general recommendations, and may describe the response procedure for Small Spill and Large Spill ›› FIRST AID: provides specific first aid guidance to use for a product or a guide in addition to the general first aid guidance for hazardous materials/ dangerous goods incidents. General first aid guidance is found in the “General First Aid” section situated immediately after the “How to use the Orange Guides” section. • Call 911 or emergency medical service. • Ensure that medical personnel are aware of the material(s) involved, take precautions to protect themselves and avoid contamination. • Move victim to fresh air if it can be done safely. • Administer oxygen if breathing is difficult. • If victim is not breathing: –– DO NOT perform mouth-to-mouth resuscitation; the victim may have ingested or inhaled the substance. –– If equipped and pulse detected, wash face and mouth, then give artificial respiration using a proper respiratory medical device (bag-valve mask, pocket mask equipped with a one-way valve or other device). –– If no pulse detected or no respiratory medical device available, provide continuous compressions. Conduct a pulse check every two minutes or monitor for any signs of spontaneous respirations. • Remove and isolate contaminated clothing and shoes. • For minor skin contact, avoid spreading material on unaffected skin. • In case of contact with substance, remove immediately by flushing skin or eyes with running water for at least 20 minutes. • For severe burns, immediate medical attention is required. • Effects of exposure (inhalation, ingestion, or skin contact) to substance may be delayed. • Keep victim calm and warm. • Keep victim under observation. • For further assistance, contact your local Poison Control Center. • Note: Basic Life Support (BLS) and Advanced Life Support (ALS) should be done by trained professionals. (此章節分為三個子章節： ›› 火災：針對小火、大火及/或涉及槽體或車輛/拖車載荷的火災提供滅火程序。 ›› 洩漏：包括一般建議，並可能描述小洩漏及大洩漏的應變程序。 ›› 急救：提供除了危險物質/危險品事故一般急救指引外，適用於特定產品或指南的特定急救指引。一般急救指引位於「如何使用橘色指南」章節之後的「一般急救」章節。 • 撥打 119 或緊急醫療服務。 • 確保醫療人員知曉所涉及的物質，採取預防措施保護自身並避免污染。 • 在安全的情況下，將傷者移至通風處。 • 若呼吸困難則提供氧氣。 • 若傷者無呼吸： －－不可進行口對口人工呼吸；傷者可能已食入或吸入該物質。 －－若配備裝備且測得脈搏，清洗面部及口腔，隨後使用適當的醫療呼吸裝置 (袋瓣罩甦醒器、配備單向瓣膜的口袋型面罩或其他裝置) 進行人工呼吸。 －－若未測得脈搏或無醫療呼吸裝置，請進行持續按壓。每兩分鐘檢查一次脈搏，或監控是否有任何自發性呼吸徵兆。 • 移除並隔離受污染的衣物及鞋子。 • 對於輕微皮膚接觸，避免將物質擴散至未受影響的皮膚。 • 若接觸該物質，請立即以流動水沖洗皮膚或眼睛至少 20 分鐘以移除物質。 • 若嚴重灼傷，需立即就醫。 • 暴露 (吸入、食入或皮膚接觸) 物質的影響可能會延遲。 • 讓傷者保持平靜及溫暖。 • 觀察傷者情況。 • 如需進一步協助，請聯繫當地的中毒控制中心。 • 註：基本救命術 (BLS) 及高級救命術 (ALS) 應由受過訓練的專業人員執行。)
Guides (orange section): Guides (orange section) (應變指南 (橘色章節))
- May react violently or explosively on: - May react violently or explosively on contact with air, water or foam. (接觸空氣、水或泡沫可能產生劇烈或爆炸性反應。)
- Inhalation, ingestion or contact with: - Inhalation, ingestion or contact with substance may cause severe injury, infection, disease or death. (吸入、食入或接觸物質可能造成重傷、感染、疾病或死亡。)
- High concentration of gas may cause as: - High concentration of gas may cause asphyxiation without warning. (高濃度氣體可能在無預警的情況下導致窒息。)
- Fire or contact with water may produce: - Fire or contact with water may produce irritating, toxic and/or corrosive gases. (火災或接觸水可能產生刺激性、有毒及/或腐蝕性氣體。)
- Isolate spill or leak area for at leas: - Isolate spill or leak area for at least 100 meters (330 feet) in all directions. Fire (對四周至少 100 公尺 (330 英呎) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。火災)
CAUTION: Material may react with extingu: CAUTION: Material may react with extinguishing agent. (注意：物質可能與滅火劑產生反應。)

- Isolate spill or leak area immediately: - Isolate spill or leak area immediately for at least 500 meters (1/3 mile) in all directions. (立即對四周至少 500 公尺 (1/3 英哩) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。)
- Consider initial evacuation for 800 me: - Consider initial evacuation for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions. Fire (考慮對四周進行初始疏散 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)。火災)

(若鐵路貨車或拖車捲入火災，對四周隔離 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)；並對四周發動 1600 公尺 (1 英哩) 的疏散，包括緊急應變人員。)
- DRIED OUT material may explode if expo: - DRIED OUT material may explode if exposed to heat, flame, friction or shock; treat as an explosive (GUIDE 112). (乾燥後的物質暴露於熱、火焰、摩擦或撞擊可能爆炸；將其視為爆炸物處理 (應變指南 112)。)
- Keep material wet with water or treat: - Keep material wet with water or treat as an explosive (GUIDE 112). (用水保持物質濕潤，或將其視為爆炸物處理 (應變指南 112)。)

(某些具有毒性，吸入、食入或經皮膚吸收可能致命。特別是：含水二硝基酚 (UN1320)；含水二硝基酚鹽 (UN1321)、含水二硝基鄰甲酚鈉 (UN1348)；及含水疊氮化鋇 (UN1571) 已知具有毒性。)

- Consider initial evacuation for 500 me: - Consider initial evacuation for 500 meters (1/3 mile) in all directions. Fire (考慮對四周進行初始疏散 500 公尺 (1/3 英哩)。火災)

- If fire threatens cargo area containin: - If fire threatens cargo area containing packages bearing the 1.4S label or packages containing material classified as 1.4S, consider isolating at least 15 meters (50 feet) in all directions. (若火災威脅到含有 1.4S 標籤包裹或含有分類為 1.4S 物質的貨物區，考慮對四周至少隔離 15 公尺 (50 英呎)。)

- Never cut the high voltage (HV) or med: - Never cut the high voltage (HV) or medium voltage (MV) cabling. (切勿切斷高壓 (HV) 或中壓 (MV) 電纜。)

- If available, use large amount of wate: - If available, use large amount of water to extinguish or suppress a high-voltage battery fire. Using small amount of water could release toxic gases. (如果可能，使用大量的水來撲滅或抑制高壓電池火災。使用少量的水可能會釋放出有毒氣體。)

- UN1802, UN2032, UN3084, UN3093, UN1796: - UN1802, UN2032, UN3084, UN3093, UN1796 (above 50%), UN1826 (above 50%), and UN2031 (above 65%) may act as oxidizers. Also consult GUIDE 140. (UN1802、UN2032、UN3084、UN3093、UN1796 (50% 以上)、UN1826 (50% 以上) 及 UN2031 (超過 65%) 可能表現為氧化劑。亦請諮詢應變指南 140。)

- Category A Infectious Substances (UN28: - Category A Infectious Substances (UN2814, UN2900 or UN3549) are more hazardous, or are in a more hazardous form, than infectious substances shipped as Category B Biological Substances (UN3373) or clinical waste/medical waste (UN3291). (第一類感染性物質 (UN2814、UN2900 或 UN3549) 較危險，或處於更危險的形式，相較於以第二類生物物質 (UN3373) 或臨床廢棄物/醫療廢棄物 (UN3291) 形式運輸的感染性物質。)
- Damaged packages containing solid CO2: - Damaged packages containing solid CO2 as a refrigerant may produce water or frost from condensation of air. Do not touch this liquid as it could be contaminated by the contents of the parcel. (受損的包裹若含有固體二氧化碳作為冷媒，可能因空氣冷凝而產生水或霜。不可接觸此液體，因其可能已被包裹內容物污染。)
- Contact with solid CO2 may cause burns: - Contact with solid CO2 may cause burns, severe injury and/or frostbite. (接觸固體二氧化碳可能造成灼傷、重傷及/或凍傷。)
- Some may be transported in flammable l: - Some may be transported in flammable liquids. (某些物質是在易燃液體中運輸。)
- Consult the shipping paper to identify: - Consult the shipping paper to identify the substance involved. (請查閱運輸單據以識別涉及的物質。)
- Use judgement based on the amount of m: - Use judgement based on the amount of material present and the possible routes of exposure to select protective clothing. (根據現場物質數量及可能的暴露途徑，判斷並選擇防護衣物。)
- Wear appropriate respiratory protectio: - Wear appropriate respiratory protection, such as fit-tested N95 respirator (at minimum), powered air purifying respirator (PAPR), or positive pressure self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA). (穿戴適當的呼吸防護具，例如經密合度測試的 N95 口罩 (最低要求)、動力空氣濾淨式呼吸防護具 (PAPR) 或正壓式自攜式呼吸防護具 (SCBA)。)
- Wear full coverage body protection (e.g., Tyvek suit), faceshield, and disposable fluid-resistant gloves (e.g., latex or nitrile). (穿戴全身防護服 (如：Tyvek 隔離服)、面罩及一次性防液體手套 (如：乳膠或丁腈材質)。)
- Wear appropriate footwear; disposable: - Wear appropriate footwear; disposable shoe covers can be worn to protect against contamination. (穿戴適當鞋具；可穿戴一次性鞋套以防止污染。)
- Puncture- and cut-resistant gloves sho: - Puncture- and cut-resistant gloves should be worn over fluid-resistant gloves if sharp objects (e.g., broken glass, needles) are present. (若現場有銳利物品 (例如：碎玻璃、針頭)，應在防液體手套外穿戴防刺及防割手套。)
- Wear insulated gloves (e.g. cryo glove: - Wear insulated gloves (e.g. cryo gloves) over fluid-resistant gloves when handling dry ice (UN1845). (處理乾冰 (UN1845) 時，應在防液體手套外穿戴隔熱手套 (如：低溫手套)。)
- Decontaminate protective clothing and: - Decontaminate protective clothing and personal protective equipment after use and before cleaning or disposal with a compatible chemical disinfectant (e.g., 10% solution of bleach, equivalent to 0.5% sodium hypochlorite) or through a validated decontamination technology (e.g., autoclave) or process. (使用後及清理或處置前，使用相容的化學消毒劑 (如：10% 漂白水溶液，相當於 0.5% 次氯酸鈉) 或透過經驗證的除污技術 (如：高壓滅菌釜) 或程序對防護衣及 PPE 進行除污。)
- Cover damaged package or spilled mater: - Cover damaged package or spilled material with absorbent material such as paper towel, towel or rag to absorb any liquids, and, beginning from outside edge, pour liquid bleach or other chemical disinfectant to saturate. Keep wet with liquid bleach or other disinfectant. (使用紙巾、毛巾或抹布等吸收材料覆蓋受損包裹或洩漏物質以吸收液體，並從外緣開始倒入液態漂白水或其他化學消毒劑以浸透。使用液態漂白水或其他消毒劑保持濕潤。)
- Move victim to an isolated area if it: - Move victim to an isolated area if it can be done safely. CAUTION: Victim may be a source of contamination. (在安全情況下，將傷者移至隔離區域。注意：傷者可能成為污染源。)
- In case of contact with substance, imm: - In case of contact with substance, immediately flush eyes with running water and wash skin thoroughly with soap and water. Take caution not to break the skin. (若接觸該物質，請立即用流動水沖洗眼睛並徹底清洗皮膚。注意不要弄破皮膚。)
- Additional decontamination may also be: - Additional decontamination may also be necessary. (可能也需要進行額外的除污。)
- Effects of exposure (inhalation, inges: - Effects of exposure (inhalation, ingestion, injection/inoculation or skin contact) to substance may be delayed. Victim should consult medical professional for information regarding symptoms and treatment. (暴露於該物質 (吸入、食入、注射/接種或皮膚接觸) 的影響可能會延遲出現。傷者應諮詢醫療專業人員以獲取症狀及治療相關資訊。)
- Inhalation of vapors or dust is extrem: - Inhalation of vapors or dust is extremely irritating. (吸入蒸氣或粉塵極具刺激性。)
- May cause burning of eyes and lachryma: - May cause burning of eyes and lachrymation (flow of tears). (可能造成眼睛灼熱及催淚 (流淚)。)
- May cause coughing, difficult breathin: - May cause coughing, difficult breathing and nausea. (可能導致咳嗽、呼吸困難及噁心。)
- Brief exposure effects last only a few: - Brief exposure effects last only a few minutes. (短暫暴露的影響僅持續幾分鐘。)
- Contact may irritate or burn skin and: - Contact may irritate or burn skin and eyes. (接觸可能刺激或灼傷皮膚及眼睛。)
- Most vapors are heavier than air. (多數蒸氣比空氣重。)
- Air/vapor mixtures may explode when ig: - Air/vapor mixtures may explode when ignited. (空氣/蒸氣混合物引燃時可能發生爆炸。)
- Container may explode in heat of fire. (容器在火場熱力下可能爆炸。)
- If tank, rail tank car or highway tank: - If tank, rail tank car or highway tank is involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions. Halogenated Solvents (若槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車捲入火災，請對四周隔離 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)。鹵化溶劑)
- Stop leak if you can do it without ris: - Stop leak if you can do it without risk. Small Liquid Spill (在無風險的情況下設法止漏。液體小洩漏)
- Pick up with sand, earth or other non-: - Pick up with sand, earth or other non-combustible absorbent material. (使用沙、土或其他非易燃吸收材料拾起。)
- Wash skin with soap and water. Halogen: - Wash skin with soap and water. Halogenated Solvents (用肥皂和水清洗皮膚。鹵化溶劑)
- Very low levels of contained radioacti: - Very low levels of contained radioactive materials and low radiation levels outside packages result in low risks to people. Damaged packages may release measurable amounts of radioactive material, but the resulting risks are expected to be low. (包裹內含極低強度的放射性物質且包裹外部輻射強度極低，對人員造成的風險極低。受損包裹可能釋放可測量的放射性物質，但造成的風險預期仍低。)
- Packages do not have RADIOACTIVE I, II: - Packages do not have RADIOACTIVE I, II, or III labels. Some may have EMPTY labels or may have the word “Radioactive” in the package marking. (包裹上沒有「放射性 (RADIOACTIVE) I、II 或 III」標籤。某些可能貼有「空器 (EMPTY)」標籤或在包裝標示中含有「放射性」字樣。)
- Many have cardboard outer packaging; c: - Many have cardboard outer packaging; content (physically large or small) can be of many different physical forms. (許多包裹採用紙板外包裝；內容物 (體積大小皆有) 可能是多種不同的物理形態。)
- Low radiation hazard when material is: - Low radiation hazard when material is inside container. If material is released from package or bulk container, hazard will vary from low to moderate. Level of hazard will depend on the type and amount of radioactivity, the kind of material it is in, and/or the surfaces it is on. (當物質位於容器內時，輻射危害較低。若物質從包裹或散裝容器外洩，危害將從低度至中度不等。危害程度取決於放射性強度、內含物質種類及/或其所在的表面。)
- Some material may be released from pac: - Some material may be released from packages during accidents of moderate severity but risks to people are not great. (在強度中等的事故中，某些物質可能從包裹中釋放，但對人員的風險並不大。)
- Released radioactive materials or cont: - Released radioactive materials or contaminated objects usually will be visible if packaging fails. (若包裝失效，外洩的放射性物質或受污染物品通常是可見的。)
- Some exclusive use shipments of bulk a: - Some exclusive use shipments of bulk and packaged materials will not have RADIOACTIVE labels. Placards, markings and shipping papers provide identification. (某些散裝及包裝材料的專用運輸件不會貼有放射性標籤。警告標牌、標示及運輸單據可供識別。)
- Some packages may have a RADIOACTIVE l: - Some packages may have a RADIOACTIVE label and a second hazard label. The second hazard is usually greater than the radiation hazard; so follow this GUIDE as well as the response GUIDE for the second hazard class label. (某些包裹可能同時貼有放射性標籤及第二種危害標籤。第二種危害通常大於輻射危害；因此請同時遵守本指南及第二種危害類別標籤的應變指南。)
- Uranium and Thorium metal cuttings may: - Uranium and Thorium metal cuttings may ignite spontaneously if exposed to air (see GUIDE 136). (鈾金屬及釷金屬切屑暴露於空氣中可能自燃 (請參閱應變指南 136)。)
- Nitrates are oxidizers and may ignite: - Nitrates are oxidizers and may ignite other combustibles (see GUIDE 141). (硝酸鹽類屬氧化劑，可能引燃其他易燃物 (請參閱應變指南 141)。)
- Dike to collect large liquid spills. (築堤收集大量液體洩漏。)
- Type A packages (cartons, boxes, drums: - Type A packages (cartons, boxes, drums, articles, etc.) identified as Type A by marking on packages or by shipping papers contain non-life-endangering amounts. Partial releases might be expected if Type A packages are damaged in moderately severe accidents. (由包裹標示或運輸單據識別為 A 型的包裝 (紙箱、木箱、桶件、物品等) 含有非威脅生命的劑量。若 A 型包裝在強度中等的事故中受損，預期可能會有部分外洩。)
- Type B packages, and the rarely occurr: - Type B packages, and the rarely occurring Type C packages (large and small, usually metal), contain the most hazardous amounts. They can be identified by package markings or by shipping papers. Life-threatening conditions may exist only if contents are released or package shielding fails. Because of design, evaluation and testing of packages, these conditions would be expected only for accidents of utmost severity. (B 型包裝及極少見的 C 型包裝 (通常為金屬製) 含有危害最大的劑量。可以透過包裹標示或運輸單據來識別。只有在內容物外洩或包裹屏蔽失效時，才可能存在生命威脅。由於包裹的設計、評估及測試，此類狀況預期僅在極其嚴重的事故中發生。)
- The rarely occurring \"Special Arrange: - The rarely occurring "Special Arrangement" shipments may be of Type A, Type B or Type C packages. Package type will be marked on packages, and shipment details will be on shipping papers. (極少見的「特別安排」運輸件可能是 A 型、B 型或 C 型包裝。包裝類型會標示在包裹上，運輸細節則會記載於運輸單據。)
- Water from cargo fire control may caus: - Water from cargo fire control may cause pollution. (控制貨物火災產生的廢水可能造成污染。)
- Type B packages are designed and evalu: - Type B packages are designed and evaluated to withstand total engulfment in flames at temperatures of 800°C (1475°F) for a period of 30 minutes. (B 型包裝經設計與評估，可承受在 800°C (1475°F) 的火燄中完全吞沒持續 30 分鐘。)
- Damp surfaces on undamaged or slightly: - Damp surfaces on undamaged or slightly damaged packages are seldom an indication of packaging failure. Most packaging for liquid content have inner containers and/or inner absorbent materials. (未受損或輕微受損包裹表面的潮濕，極少代表包裝失效。多數裝有液態內容物的包裝設有內容器及/或內部吸收材料。)
- Undamaged packages are safe; contents: - Undamaged packages are safe; contents of damaged packages may cause external radiation exposure, and much higher external exposure if contents (source capsules) are released. (未受損的包裹是安全的；受損包裹內容物可能造成體外輻射暴露，若內容物 (放射源密封管) 外洩，則會有高得多的體外暴露風險。)
- Contamination and internal radiation h: - Contamination and internal radiation hazards are not expected, but not impossible. (預期不會有污染及體內輻射危害，但非完全不可能發生。)
- Type A packages (cartons, boxes, drums: - Type A packages (cartons, boxes, drums, articles, etc.) identified as Type A by marking on packages or by shipping papers contain non-life-endangering amounts. Radioactive sources may be released if Type A packages are damaged in moderately severe accidents. (由包裹標示或運輸單據識別為 A 型的包裝含有非威脅生命的劑量。若 A 型包裝在強度中等的事故中受損，放射源可能外洩。)
- Type B packages, and the rarely occurr: - Type B packages, and the rarely occurring Type C packages, (large and small, usually metal) contain the most hazardous amounts. They can be identified by package markings or by shipping papers. Life-threatening conditions may exist only if contents are released or package shielding fails. Because of design, evaluation and testing of packages, these conditions would be expected only for accidents of utmost severity. (B 型包裝及極少見的 C 型包裝 (通常為金屬製) 含有危害最大的劑量。可以透過包裹標示或運輸單據來識別。只有在內容物外洩或包裹屏蔽失效時，才可能存在生命威脅。由於包裹的設計、評估及測試，此類狀況預期僅在極其嚴重的事故中發生。)
- Radiation from the package contents, u: - Radiation from the package contents, usually in durable metal capsules, can be detected by most radiation instruments. (包裹內容物產生的輻射 (通常位於耐用的金屬密封管內) 可由多數輻射偵測儀器測得。)
- Packagings can burn completely without: - Packagings can burn completely without risk of content loss from sealed source capsule. (外包裝可能完全燒毀，但內容物從放射源密封管外洩的風險極低。)
- Radioactive source capsules and Type B: - Radioactive source capsules and Type B packages are designed and evaluated to withstand total engulfment in flames at temperatures of 800°C (1475°F) for a period of 30 minutes. (放射源密封管及 B 型包裝經設計與評估，可承受在 800°C (1475°F) 的火燄中完全吞沒持續 30 分鐘。)
- Delay final cleanup until instructions: - Delay final cleanup until instructions or advice is received from Radiation Authority. (延後最終清理工作，直到收到輻射主管機關的指示或建議。)
- When a large quantity of this material: - When a large quantity of this material is involved in a major fire, consider an initial evacuation distance of 300 meters (1000 feet) in all directions. Low to High Level External Radiation) (當大量此類物質捲入大火時，考慮對四周進行初始疏散距離為 300 公尺 (1000 英呎)。低至高強度體外輻射)
- Damp surfaces on undamaged or slightly: - Damp surfaces on undamaged or slightly damaged packages are seldom an indication of packaging failure. Contents are seldom liquid. Content is usually a metal capsule, easily seen if released from package. (未受損或輕微受損包裹表面的潮濕，極少代表包裝失效。內容物極少為液態。通常為金屬密封管，若從包裹內脫落，容易被看見。)
- If source capsule is identified as bei: - If source capsule is identified as being out of package, DO NOT TOUCH. Stay away and await advice from Radiation Authority. (若發現放射源密封管脫離包裝，不可接觸。請遠離並等待來自輻射主管機關的建議。)
- Persons exposed to special form source: - Persons exposed to special form sources are not likely to be contaminated with radioactive material. (暴露於特殊形式放射源的人員，不太可能受到放射性物質的污染。)
- Injured persons contaminated by contac: - Injured persons contaminated by contact with released material are not a serious hazard to health care personnel, equipment or facilities. Low to High Level External Radiation) (因接觸外洩物質而受污染的傷者，對醫護人員、設備或設施不會構成嚴重威脅。低至高強度體外輻射)
- Type AF or IF packages, identified by: - Type AF or IF packages, identified by package markings, do not contain life-threatening amounts of material. External radiation levels are low and packages are designed, evaluated and tested to control releases and to prevent a fission chain reaction under severe transport conditions. (由標示識別為 AF 或 IF 型的包裝，不含威脅生命劑量的物質。體外輻射強度低，且包裝經設計、評估及測試，能控制外洩並防止在嚴酷運輸條件下發生核分裂連鎖反應。)
- Type B(U)F, B(M)F and CF packages (ide: - Type B(U)F, B(M)F and CF packages (identified by markings on packages or shipping papers) contain potentially life-endangering amounts. Because of design, evaluation and testing of packages, fission chain reactions are prevented and releases are not expected to be life-endangering for all accidents except those of utmost severity. (B(U)F、B(M)F 及 CF 型包裝 (由包裹標示或運輸單據識別) 含有具潛在威脅生命的劑量。由於包裹的設計、評估及測試，可防止核分裂連鎖反應，且除極其嚴重的事故外，外洩預期不會威脅生命。)
- The rarely occurring \"Special Arrange: - The rarely occurring "Special Arrangement" shipments may be of Type AF, BF or CF packages. Package type will be marked on packages, and shipment details will be on shipping papers. (極少見的「特別安排」運輸件可能是 AF、BF 或 CF 型包裝。包裝類型會標示在包裹上，運輸細節則會記載於運輸單據。)
- The transport index (TI) shown on labe: - The transport index (TI) shown on labels or a shipping paper might not indicate the radiation level at one meter from a single, isolated, undamaged package; instead, it might relate to controls needed during transport because of the fissile properties of the materials. Alternatively, the fissile nature of the contents is indicated by a criticality safety index (CSI) on a special FISSILE label or on the shipping paper. (標示在標籤或運輸單據上的運輸指數 (TI) 可能不代表距離單個隔離、未受損包裹一公尺處的輻射強度；相反地，它可能與運輸期間所需的管制有關，原因在於物質的可裂變特性。或者，內容物的可裂變性質會由特殊的「可裂變 (FISSILE)」標籤或運輸單據上的「臨界安全指數 (CSI)」標示。)
- These materials are seldom flammable. Packages are designed to withstand fires without damage to contents. (這些物質極少具易燃性。包裝經設計可承受火災而內容物不致受損。)
- Type AF, IF, B(U)F, B(M)F and CF packa: - Type AF, IF, B(U)F, B(M)F and CF packages are designed and evaluated to withstand total engulfment in flames at temperatures of 800°C (1475°F) for a period of 30 minutes. (AF、IF、B(U)F、B(M)F 及 CF 型包裝經設計與評估，可承受在 800°C (1475°F) 的火燄中完全吞沒持續 30 分鐘。)
- Damp surfaces on undamaged or slightly: - Damp surfaces on undamaged or slightly damaged packages are seldom an indication of packaging failure. Most packaging for liquid content have inner containers and/or inner absorbent materials. Liquid Spill (未受損或輕微受損包裹表面的潮濕，極少代表包裝失效。多數裝有液態內容物的包裝設有內容器及/或內部吸收材料。液體洩漏)
- Package contents are seldom liquid. If: - Package contents are seldom liquid. If any radioactive contamination resulting from a liquid release is present, it probably will be low-level. (包裹內容物極少為液態。若存在因液體外洩導致的放射性污染，其強度可能很低。)
- Low radiation hazard to people. Chemic: - Low radiation hazard to people. Chemical hazard greatly exceeds radiation hazard. (對人員輻射危害低。化學危害遠大於輻射危害。)
- Substance reacts with water and water: - Substance reacts with water and water vapor in air to form toxic and corrosive hydrogen fluoride gas, hydrofluoric acid, and an extremely irritating and corrosive, white-colored, water-soluble residue. (該物質與水及空氣中的水蒸氣反應，產生有毒及腐蝕性的氟化氫氣體、氫氟酸，以及極具刺激性與腐蝕性、白色、水溶性的殘留物。)
- Toxic; may be fatal if inhaled, ingest: - Toxic; may be fatal if inhaled, ingested, or absorbed through skin. (有毒；吸入、食入或經皮膚吸收可能致命。)
- Direct contact with substance and gas: - Direct contact with substance and gas may cause burns to skin, eyes, or respiratory tract. (直接接觸物質及氣體可能造成皮膚、眼睛或呼吸道灼傷。)
- Substance does not burn. (該物質不燃。)
- The material may react violently with: - The material may react violently with fuels. (該物質可能與燃料產生劇烈反應。)
- Product will decompose to produce toxi: - Product will decompose to produce toxic and/or corrosive fumes. (產品分解會產生有毒及/或腐蝕性煙霧。)
- Containers in protective overpacks (ho: - Containers in protective overpacks (horizontal cylindrical shape with short legs for tie-downs), are identified with AF, B(U)F or H(U) on shipping papers or by markings on the overpacks. They are designed and evaluated to withstand severe conditions including total engulfment in flames at temperatures of 800°C (1475°F) for a period of 30 minutes. (裝在防護性外包裝內的容器，在運輸單據或外包裝標示上有 AF、B(U)F 或 H(U) 字樣。其經設計與評估，可承受嚴酷條件，包括在 800°C (1475°F) 的火燄中完全吞沒持續 30 分鐘。)
- Bare filled cylinders, identified with: - Bare filled cylinders, identified with UN2978 as part of the marking (may also be marked H(U) or H(M)), may rupture in heat of engulfing fire; bare empty (except for residue) cylinders will not rupture in fires. (標有 UN2978 的裸露充填鋼瓶，在火燄吞沒的高熱下可能破裂；裸露的空鋼瓶則不會在火災中破裂。)
- When a large quantity of this material: - When a large quantity of this material is involved in a major fire, consider an initial evacuation distance of 300 meters (1000 feet) in all directions. (Uranium Hexafluoride/Water-Reactive) (當大量此類物質捲入大火時，考慮對四周進行初始疏散距離為 300 公尺 (1000 英呎)。(六氟化鈾/禁水反應性))
- DO NOT USE WATER OR FOAM ON MATERIAL I: - DO NOT USE WATER OR FOAM ON MATERIAL ITSELF. (不可將水或泡沫直接用於物質本身。)
- Dry chemical, CO2, or withdraw from ar: - Dry chemical, CO2, or withdraw from area and let fire burn. (使用乾粉、二氧化碳，或者撤離該區域並讓其燒完。)
- Only use water if the package is intac: - Only use water if the package is intact. (僅在包裹完好無損時才可使用水。)
- Without fire or smoke, leak will be ev: - Without fire or smoke, leak will be evident by visible and irritating vapors and residue forming at the point of release. (在無火或無煙的情況下，外洩可由可見且具刺激性的蒸氣及在釋放點形成的殘留物來察覺。)
- Use water spray to reduce vapors or di: - Use water spray to reduce vapors or divert vapor cloud drift. Avoid allowing water runoff to contact spilled material. (使用霧狀水減少蒸氣或引導蒸氣雲飄移。避免讓廢水接觸洩漏物質。)
- Residue buildup may self-seal small le: - Residue buildup may self-seal small leaks. (殘留物的積聚可能使微小洩漏處自密封。)
- Dike far ahead of spill to collect run: - Dike far ahead of spill to collect runoff water. (在洩漏前方遠處築堤以收集廢水。)
- In case of skin contact with hydrogen: - In case of skin contact with hydrogen fluoride gas and/or Hydrofluoric acid, if calcium gluconate gel is available, rinse 5 minutes, then apply gel. Otherwise, continue rinsing until medical treatment is available. (若皮膚接觸氟化氫氣體及/或氫氟酸，如果備有葡萄糖酸鈣軟膏，請先沖洗 5 分鐘，然後塗抹軟膏。否則，持續沖洗直到獲得醫療處理。)
- Do not delay care and transport of a s: - Do not delay care and transport of a seriously injured person. (Uranium Hexafluoride/Water-Reactive) (不可延誤傷勢嚴重者的護理及轉送。(六氟化鈾/禁水反應性))
- Inhalation extremely dangerous; may be: - Inhalation extremely dangerous; may be fatal. (吸入極度危險；可能致命。)
- Odorless, will not be detected by sens: - Odorless, will not be detected by sense of smell. (無氣味，嗅覺無法察覺。)
- EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE. CAUTION: Flame ca: - EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE. CAUTION: Flame can be invisible. Use an alternate method of detection (thermal camera, broom handle, etc.) (極度易燃。注意：火焰可能不可見。請使用替代偵測法 (熱顯像儀、掃帚柄等)。)
- If tank, rail tank car or highway tank: - If tank, rail tank car or highway tank is involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions. Carbon Monoxide (Refrigerated Liquid) (若槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車捲入火災，請對四周隔離 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)。一氧化碳 (冷凍液體))
CAUTION: Flame can be invisible. Use an: CAUTION: Flame can be invisible. Use an alternate method of detection (thermal camera, broom handle, etc.) (注意：火焰可能不可見。請使用替代偵測法 (熱顯像儀、掃帚柄等)。)
- In case of contact with liquefied gas,: - In case of contact with liquefied gas, only medical personnel should attempt thawing frosted parts. Carbon Monoxide (Refrigerated Liquid) (若接觸到液化氣體，僅能由醫療人員嘗試解凍凍傷部位。一氧化碳 (冷凍液體))
- Substance is transported in molten for: - Substance is transported in molten form at a temperature above 705°C (1300°F). (物質以熔融形式運輸，溫度超過 705°C (1300°F)。)
- Violent reaction with water; contact m: - Violent reaction with water; contact may cause an explosion or may produce a flammable gas. (與水產生劇烈反應；接觸可能導致爆炸或產生易燃氣體。)
- Will ignite combustible materials (woo: - Will ignite combustible materials (wood, paper, oil, debris, etc.). (會引燃易燃材料 (木材、紙張、油、碎屑等)。)
- Contact with nitrates or other oxidize: - Contact with nitrates or other oxidizers may cause an explosion. (接觸硝酸鹽或其他氧化劑可能導致爆炸。)
- Contact with containers or other mater: - Contact with containers or other materials, including cold, wet or dirty tools, may cause an explosion. (與容器或其他材料接觸，包括寒冷、潮濕或髒污的工具，可能導致爆炸。)
- Contact with concrete will cause spall: - Contact with concrete will cause spalling and small pops. (與混凝土接觸會導致剝落並產生微小的爆裂聲。)
- Contact causes severe burns to skin an: - Contact causes severe burns to skin and eyes. (接觸造成皮膚及眼睛嚴重灼傷。)
- Wear flame-retardant structural firefi: - Wear flame-retardant structural firefighters’ protective clothing, including faceshield, helmet and gloves, as this will provide limited thermal protection. (穿戴阻燃型消防人員防護衣，包括面罩、頭盔及手套，因其僅能提供有限的熱防護。)
- Isolate spill or leak area for at leas: - Isolate spill or leak area for at least 50 meters (150 feet) in all directions. Aluminum (Molten) (對四周至少 50 公尺 (150 英呎) 的洩漏區域進行隔離。鋁 (熔融態))
- Do not use water, except in life-threa: - Do not use water, except in life-threatening situations and then only in a fine spray. (不可用水，除非在威脅生命的狀況下，且僅限使用細霧噴灑。)
- Do not use halogenated extinguishing a: - Do not use halogenated extinguishing agents or foam. (不可使用鹵化滅火劑或泡沫。)
- Move combustibles out of path of advan: - Move combustibles out of path of advancing pool if you can do so without risk. (在無風險的情況下，將路徑上的易燃物移開。)
- Extinguish fires started by molten mat: - Extinguish fires started by molten material by using appropriate method for the burning material; keep water, halogenated extinguishing agents and foam away from the molten material. (使用適合該燃燒物質的方法撲滅由熔融物質引發的火災；將水、鹵化滅火劑及泡沫遠離熔融物質。)
- Do not attempt to stop leak, due to da: - Do not attempt to stop leak, due to danger of explosion. (由於有爆炸危險，不可嘗試止漏。)
- Substance is very fluid, spreads quick: - Substance is very fluid, spreads quickly, and may splash. Do not try to stop it with shovels or other objects. (物質流動性極強、擴散迅速且可能噴濺。不可試圖用鏟子或其他物體阻擋。)
- Dike far ahead of spill; use dry sand: - Dike far ahead of spill; use dry sand to contain the flow of material. (在洩漏前方遠處築堤；使用乾沙攔截物流。)
- Where possible allow molten material t: - Where possible allow molten material to solidify naturally. (如果可能，讓熔融物質自然凝固。)
- Avoid contact even after material soli: - Avoid contact even after material solidifies. Molten, heated and cold aluminum look alike; do not touch unless you know it is cold. (即使在物質凝固後也要避免接觸。熔融、受熱及冷卻的鋁看起來都很像；除非確認已冷卻，否則不可接觸。)
- Clean up under the supervision of an e: - Clean up under the supervision of an expert after material has solidified. (在物質凝固後，於專家的監督下進行清理。)
- Removal of solidified molten material: - Removal of solidified molten material from skin requires medical assistance. Aluminum (Molten) (從皮膚上移除凝固的熔融物質需要醫療協助。鋁 (熔融態))
- May react violently or explosively on: - May react violently or explosively on contact with water. (接觸水可能產生劇烈或爆炸性反應。)
- Some are transported in flammable liqu: - Some are transported in flammable liquids. (某些物質是在易燃液體中運輸。)
- Some of these materials will burn with: - Some of these materials will burn with intense heat. (其中某些物質燃燒時會產生高熱。)
- Dusts or fumes may form explosive mixt: - Dusts or fumes may form explosive mixtures in air. (粉塵或煙霧與空氣可能形成爆炸性混合物。)
- Oxides from metallic fires are a sever: - Oxides from metallic fires are a severe health hazard. (金屬火災產生的氧化物對健康有嚴重危害。)
- Inhalation or contact with substance o: - Inhalation or contact with substance or decomposition products may cause severe injury or death. (吸入或接觸物質或其分解產物可能造成嚴重傷害或死亡。)
- Consider initial downwind evacuation f: - Consider initial downwind evacuation for at least 50 meters (160 feet). Fire (考慮對下風處進行初始疏散至少 50 公尺 (160 英呎)。火災)
- If tank, rail tank car or highway tank: - If tank, rail tank car or highway tank is involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 800 meters (1/2 mile) in all directions. Metals (Powders, Dusts, Shavings, Borings, Turnings, or Cuttings, etc.) (若槽體、鐵路槽車或公路槽車捲入火災，請對四周隔離 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 800 公尺 (1/2 英哩)。金屬 (粉末、粉塵、切屑、鑽屑、車屑或鋸屑等))
- DO NOT USE WATER, FOAM OR CO2. (不可使用水、泡沫或二氧化碳。)
- Dousing metallic fires with water will: - Dousing metallic fires with water will generate hydrogen gas, an extremely dangerous explosion hazard, particularly if fire is in a confined environment (i.e., building, cargo hold, etc.). (用水澆灌金屬火災會產生氫氣，這是極危險的爆炸威脅，特別是在受限環境 (如：建築物、貨艙等) 時。)
- Use DRY sand, graphite powder, dry sod: - Use DRY sand, graphite powder, dry sodium chloride-based extinguishers, or class D extinguishers. (使用乾沙、石墨粉、乾氯化鈉基滅火器或 D 類滅火器。)
- Confining and smothering metal fires i: - Confining and smothering metal fires is preferable rather than applying water. (局限並窒息金屬火災優於噴水撲滅。)
- If impossible to extinguish, protect s: - If impossible to extinguish, protect surroundings and allow fire to burn itself out. (若無法撲滅，請保護周邊環境並讓火自行燒完。)
Refer to the “General First Aid” section: Refer to the “General First Aid” section. Metals (Powders, Dusts, Shavings, Borings, Turnings, or Cuttings, etc.) (請參閱「一般急救」章節。金屬 (粉末、粉塵、切屑、鑽屑、車屑或鋸屑等))
- Some may be transported hot. (某些物質可能以高溫狀態運輸。)
- For UN3508, Capacitor, asymmetric, be: - For UN3508, Capacitor, asymmetric, be aware of possible short circuiting as this product is transported in a charged state. (對於 UN3508 不對稱電容器，由於產品是在帶電狀態下運輸，請留意可能的短路風險。)
- Polymeric beads, expandable (UN2211) m: - Polymeric beads, expandable (UN2211) may evolve flammable vapours. (可膨脹聚合物顆粒 (UN2211) 可能釋放易燃蒸氣。)
- Inhalation of material may be harmful. (吸入此物質可能有危害。)
- Inhalation of Asbestos dust may have a: - Inhalation of Asbestos dust may have a damaging effect on the lungs. (吸入石綿粉塵可能對肺部造成損傷。)
- Some liquids produce vapors that may c: - Some liquids produce vapors that may cause dizziness or asphyxiation. (某些液體產生的蒸氣可能導致暈眩或窒息。)
CAUTION: Fire involving Safety devices (: CAUTION: Fire involving Safety devices (UN3268) and Fire suppressant dispersing devices (UN3559) may have a delayed activation and a risk of hazardous projectiles. Extinguish the fire at a safe distance. (注意：涉及安全裝置 (UN3268) 及滅火劑分散裝置 (UN3559) 的火災可能會有延遲啟動及危險噴射物的風險。請在安全距離外滅火。)
- Dike runoff from fire control for late: - Dike runoff from fire control for later disposal. Fire Involving Tanks (築堤攔截滅火廢水，以便後續處理。涉及槽體的火災)
- Prevent dust cloud. (防止產生粉塵雲。)
- For Asbestos, avoid inhalation of dust: - For Asbestos, avoid inhalation of dust. Cover spill with plastic sheet or tarp to minimize spreading. Do not clean up or dispose of, except under supervision of a specialist. Small Dry Spill (對於石綿，避免吸入粉塵。用塑膠布或防水布覆蓋洩漏物以減少擴散。除非在專家的監督下，否則不可清理或處置。固體小洩漏)
- Inhalation of vapors or contact with s: - Inhalation of vapors or contact with substance will result in contamination and potential harmful effects. (吸入蒸氣或接觸物質將導致污染並產生潛在危害影響。)
- Non-combustible, substance itself does: - Non-combustible, substance itself does not burn but may react upon heating to produce corrosive and/or toxic fumes. (非易燃，物質本身不燃，但受熱反應可能產生腐蝕性及/或有毒煙霧。)
- When any large container is involved i: - When any large container is involved in a fire, consider initial evacuation for 500 meters (1/3 mile) in all directions. Gallium and Mercury (當任何大型容器捲入火災時，考慮對四周進行初始疏散 500 公尺 (1/3 英哩)。鎵與汞)
- Do not direct water at the heated meta: - Do not direct water at the heated metal. (噴水時不要對準受熱的金屬。)
- Do not use steel or aluminum tools or: - Do not use steel or aluminum tools or equipment. (不可使用鋼製或鋁製的工具或設備。)
- Cover with earth, sand or other non-co: - Cover with earth, sand or other non-combustible material followed with plastic sheet to minimize spreading or contact with rain. (使用土、沙或其他非易燃材料覆蓋，並加上塑膠布遮蓋以減少擴散或與雨水接觸。)
- For mercury, use a mercury spill kit. (對於汞，請使用汞洩漏處理組。)
- Mercury spill areas may be subsequentl: - Mercury spill areas may be subsequently treated with calcium sulphide/calcium sulfide or with sodium thiosulphate/sodium thiosulfate wash to neutralize any residual mercury. (汞洩漏區域隨後可使用硫化鈣或硫代硫酸鈉洗液處理，以中和殘留的汞。)
Refer to the “General First Aid” section: Refer to the “General First Aid” section. Gallium and Mercury (請參閱「一般急救」章節。鎵與汞)
- Vapors may be irritating. (蒸氣可能具刺激性。)
- Some gases may burn or be ignited by h: - Some gases may burn or be ignited by heat, sparks or flames. (某些氣體可能燃燒或被熱、火星、火焰引燃。)
- Oxidizers may ignite combustibles (woo: - Oxidizers may ignite combustibles (wood, paper, oil, clothing, etc.) but NOT readily due to low transportation pressures. (氧化劑可能引燃易燃物 (木材、紙張、油、衣物等)，但因其運輸壓力較低，因此不易引燃。)
- Runoff may create fire hazard. (殘餘廢水可能產生火災危險。)
- If several small packages (inside a ra: - If several small packages (inside a railcar or trailer) are involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 1600 meters (1 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 1600 meters (1 mile) in all directions. Adsorbed Gases - Toxic* (若多個小包裝 (在鐵路貨車或拖車內) 捲入火災，對四周隔離 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)。吸附氣體 - 有毒*)
* \u0007Some substances may also be flam: * Some substances may also be flammable, corrosive and/or oxidizing (* 某些物質亦可能具易燃性、腐蝕性及/或氧化性)
- For UN3515, UN3518, UN3520, use water: - For UN3515, UN3518, UN3520, use water only; no dry chemical, CO2 or Halon®. (對於 UN3515、UN3518、UN3520，僅能用水；不可使用乾粉、二氧化碳或海龍。)
- Some gases may be flammable. ELIMINATE: - Some gases may be flammable. ELIMINATE all ignition sources (no smoking, flares, sparks or flames) from immediate area. (某些氣體可能具易燃性。消除區域內所有引火源 (禁止吸菸、火光、火星或火焰)。)
- For flammable gases, all equipment use: - For flammable gases, all equipment used when handling the product must be grounded. (對於易燃氣體，處理產品時使用的所有設備必須接地。)
- In case of burns, immediately cool aff: - In case of burns, immediately cool affected skin for as long as possible with cold water. Do not remove clothing if adhering to skin. Adsorbed Gases - Toxic* (若發生灼傷，請立即用冷水冷卻受影響的皮膚。若衣服黏貼在皮膚上，請勿強行脫去。吸附氣體 - 有毒*)
Adsorbed Gases - Flammable or Oxidizing: Adsorbed Gases - Flammable or Oxidizing (吸附氣體 - 易燃或氧化性)
- Some gases will be ignited by heat, sp: - Some gases will be ignited by heat, sparks or flames. (某些氣體會被熱、火星或火焰引燃。)
- Containers may explode when exposed to: - Containers may explode when exposed to prolonged direct flame impingement. (容器長時間暴露於火焰直接衝擊下可能會爆炸。)
- If several small packages (inside a ra: - If several small packages (inside a railcar or trailer) are involved in a fire, ISOLATE for 1600 meters (1 mile) in all directions; also, consider initial evacuation for 1600 meters (1 mile) in all directions. Adsorbed Gases - Flammable or Oxidizing (若多個小包裝 (在鐵路貨車或拖車內) 捲入火災，對四周隔離 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)；並考慮對四周初始疏散 1600 公尺 (1 英哩)。吸附氣體 - 易燃或氧化性)
- For flammable gases, ELIMINATE all ign: - For flammable gases, ELIMINATE all ignition sources (no smoking, flares, sparks or flames) from immediate area. (對於易燃氣體，消除區域內所有引火源 (禁止吸菸、火光、火星或火焰)。)
- In case of burns, immediately cool aff: - In case of burns, immediately cool affected skin for as long as possible with cold water. Do not remove clothing if adhering to skin. • (若發生灼傷，請立即用冷水冷卻受影響的皮膚。若衣服黏貼在皮膚上，請勿強行脫去。 •)
